DataElement.preferredName: HEAR-QL-26 4 Harder Time Hearing in Noisy Places than Friends Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response of whether they have a harder time hearing in noisy places than friends, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hearing Environments and Reflection on Quality of Life for Children Harder Time Hearing in Noisy Places than Friends Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess how a child is affected by their hearing loss, and to aid a clinician in determining where intervention is warranted to improve the child's overall wellbeing._A question about whether an individual thinks that they have or had a harder time hearing in noisy places than their friends._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hearing Environments And Reflection on Quality of Life 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes from 0 (Almost Always) to 4 (Never) on a 5-point Likert scale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.15 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002731. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do you think you have a harde
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you think you have a harder time hearing than your friends in noisy places (restaurants, ball games, field trips, etc.)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
